segments.en: And today we have a great lesson for all our upper intermediate students.
segments.cn: 今天我们为所有中高级学生准备了一堂精彩的课程。

segments.en: We're talking about airplane travel today.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论飞机旅行。

segments.en: So we're going to be in an airplane.
segments.cn: 所以我们将会在飞机上。

segments.en: And we're going to be listening to some of the common things you might hear on an announcement in the airplane.
segments.cn: 我们将听到一些你在飞机上可能会听到的常见公告。

segments.en: Yeah, usually the flight attendant or the captain will come on and say something.
segments.cn: 是的，通常是空乘人员或机长会出来说些什么。

segments.en: And, well, usually it's in English, so we've got to understand what they're saying.
segments.cn: 而且，通常是用英语，所以我们得理解他们在说什么。

segments.en: And we'll also learn some great phrases that you can use when you want to describe flights to your friends when you're talking to them.
segments.cn: 我们还会学习一些很棒的短语，当你想向朋友描述航班时可以使用。

segments.en: You arrive somewhere and people are like, hey, how was your flight?
segments.cn: 你到达某地，人们会问，嘿，你的航班怎么样？

segments.en: Now you know how to answer it.
segments.cn: 现在你知道怎么回答了。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 那我们来看看我们的词汇预览吧。

segments.en: Well, we've got three words for you here in our vocabulary preview all about flying.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在词汇预览中有三个与飞行相关的单词。

segments.en: Well, turbulence, when you're in an airplane, basically is air that is moving in all directions really fast.
segments.cn: 嗯，颠簸，基本上是在飞机上时，空气在各个方向快速移动。

segments.en: So the airplane will start to shake.
It's the same thing if you're flying a kite and maybe some turbulence is in the air, your kite will maybe fall to the ground.
segments.cn: 如果你在放风筝，空气中有一些颠簸，你的风筝可能会掉到地上。

segments.en: So it's air that's moving in all directions.
segments.cn: 所以这是空气在各个方向移动。

segments.en: Well, we'll hear how this word is used in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们会在对话中听到这个词的用法。

segments.en: But another airplane word we hear a lot.
segments.cn: 但还有另一个我们经常听到的飞机词。

segments.en: So the flight crew is basically the team.
segments.cn: 所以航班机组基本上是团队。

segments.en: It's all the people that are in the airplane.
segments.cn: 他们是飞机上的所有人。

segments.en: So it's basically the captain and the co-pilot.
segments.cn: 所以基本上是机长和副驾驶。

segments.en: And what about our last word?
segments.cn: 那我们的最后一个词呢？

segments.en: So what would be an example of a bumpy ride?
segments.cn: 那么颠簸的旅程的例子是什么？

segments.en: Okay, imagine if you're driving in your car and you're driving on a dirt road, like with many holes in it and rocks.
segments.cn: 好吧，想象一下你在开车，行驶在一条有很多坑和石头的土路上。

segments.en: You're driving on that road and it would be really, really bumpy.
segments.cn: 你在那条路上开车，会非常颠簸。

segments.en: So your car will be moving a lot.
segments.cn: 所以你的车会移动很多。

segments.en: So a bumpy ride is a trip where you move and shake a lot.
segments.cn: 所以颠簸的旅程是一个你移动和摇晃很多的旅程。

segments.en: So you can say that is a bumpy road.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说那是一条颠簸的路。

segments.en: Or it was a bumpy ride.
segments.cn: 或者说这是一次颠簸的旅程。

segments.en: So now let's listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在让我们来听听我们的对话。

segments.en: We're going to be listening to these people on an airplane and the captain is going to give some instructions.
segments.cn: 我们将听到这些人在飞机上的对话，机长将给出一些指示。

segments.en: And the next thing you know, we're running towards the... Oh, did you feel that?
segments.cn: 接下来你会知道，我们正朝着... 哦，你感觉到了吗？

segments.en: We're just going through a bit of turbulence.
segments.cn: 我们只是经历了一些颠簸。

segments.en: Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain speaking.
segments.cn: 各位女士们，先生们，我是你们的机长。

segments.en: It looks like we've hit a patch of rough air.
segments.cn: 看起来我们遇到了一片粗糙的空气。

segments.en: So we're going to have a bit of a bumpy ride for the next several minutes.
segments.cn: 所以接下来的几分钟我们会有一段颠簸的旅程。

segments.en: This is why I hate flying.
segments.cn: 这就是我讨厌飞行的原因。

segments.en: At this time, I'd like to remind all our passengers to fasten their seat belts and remain seated until the fasten seat belt sign is turned off.
segments.cn: 此时，我想提醒所有乘客系好安全带，并在安全带指示灯熄灭之前保持坐在座位上。

segments.en: Please ensure all cabin baggage is carefully stowed under the seat in front of you.
segments.cn: 请确保所有舱内行李妥善放置在您前面的座位下。

segments.en: I'll be back to update you in a minute.
segments.cn: 我会在一分钟内回来更新您。

segments.en: Uh, ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain again.
segments.cn: 呃，女士们，先生们，我是你们的机长。

segments.en: We've got quite a large patch of rough air ahead of us.
segments.cn: 我们前方有一片较大的乱流区域。

segments.en: And so for your safety, we will be suspending in-flight service.
segments.cn: 为了您的安全，我们将暂停机上服务。

segments.en: I would ask all the in-flight crew to return to their seats at this time.
segments.cn: 我请所有机组人员此时返回座位。

segments.en: I would also ask that all our passengers refrain from using the laboratory until the seat belt sign has been switched off.
segments.cn: 我也请所有乘客在安全带指示灯熄灭之前不要使用洗手间。

segments.en: here we are with another dramatic dialogue, another explosion in English Pod.
segments.cn: 我们又来了，另一段戏剧性的对话，另一场爆炸在英语播客中。

segments.en: A lot of adventure is going on, so we'll see what happens.
segments.cn: 很多冒险正在进行中，所以我们看看会发生什么。

segments.en: Um, but I'm sure they're all right.
I'm sure... Well, I hope so.
segments.cn: 我相信... 好吧，我希望如此。

segments.en: It's kind of making me nervous for my next flight.
segments.cn: 这让我对下次飞行有点紧张。

segments.en: All right, so let's take a look at some of the words that the captain used in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看机长在语言学习中使用的一些词汇。

segments.en: All right, all of these words you'll hear really, really often when you're flying.
segments.cn: 好吧，这些词在飞行时你会非常频繁地听到。

segments.en: And the first one we have for you is fasten.
segments.cn: 我们为您准备的第一个词是系好。

segments.en: Now, this is a great word.
Do up or put on or... Connect.
segments.cn: 系紧或穿上或... 连接。

segments.en: So usually it'll be with a seat belt or a belt or something like that, right?
segments.cn: 通常是与安全带或皮带之类的东西一起使用，对吧？

segments.en: Now, the pronunciation here is interesting.
Right, so it would be fasten.
The T kind of becomes silent.
Okay, let's look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: Okay, so what is a lavatory exactly?
segments.cn: 好吧，洗手间到底是什么？

segments.en: What's the difference between bathroom, restroom, washroom, WC, lavatory?
segments.cn: 浴室、卫生间、洗手间、WC、洗手间之间有什么区别？

segments.en: I know, so many words for bathroom.
segments.cn: 我知道，浴室有这么多词。

segments.en: A lavatory is a room with a toilet and sink only.
segments.cn: 洗手间是一个只有厕所和水槽的房间。

segments.en: Only a toilet and sink, so no bathtub.
segments.cn: 只有厕所和水槽，所以没有浴缸。

segments.en: So it's very, very common to find a lavatory in boats, airplanes, or trains.
segments.cn: 所以在船、飞机或火车上找到洗手间是非常常见的。

segments.en: Even if your room in your house is only a sink and a toilet, it's still not a lavatory.
segments.cn: 即使你家里的房间只有一个水槽和一个厕所，它仍然不是洗手间。

segments.en: That's just the way it is in English.
And something interesting that you told me today.
segments.cn: 还有你今天告诉我的有趣的事情。

segments.en: That's a common thing that you'll see on a bathroom.
segments.cn: 这是你在卫生间上常见的标识。

segments.en: Okay, anyways, let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，接下来让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: So if I stow my luggage, it means... You put it in a place where you can get it easily, but it is very safe.
segments.cn: 所以如果我收纳我的行李，意味着... 你把它放在一个可以轻松取到的地方，但它是非常安全的。

segments.en: Maybe it's not even visible, right?
segments.cn: 也许它甚至不可见，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, so you put it away in a safe spot.
segments.cn: 是的，所以你把它放在一个安全的地方。

segments.en: So usually in airplanes, they will tell you to stow your luggage under your seat.
segments.cn: 所以通常在飞机上，他们会告诉你把行李放在座位下。

segments.en: Yes, or stow your luggage in the overhead bin.
segments.cn: 是的，或者把行李放在头顶行李舱。
头顶行李舱或头顶隔间。

segments.en: So this is a verb meaning avoid doing.
segments.cn: 这是一个动词，意思是避免做。

segments.en: Something interesting about this grammar-wise is it's usually followed by from.
segments.cn: 关于这个语法的有趣之处是它通常后面跟着 from。

segments.en: Refrain from, and the verb that follows is always gerund, right?
segments.cn: 克制，后面的动词总是动名词，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, so refrain from ing. Right, refrain from using the lavatory.
segments.cn: 是的，所以克制 ing。对，克制使用洗手间。

segments.en: All right, so some really great examples in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以一些非常好的语言例子。

segments.en: And well, now let's take a look at Fluency Builder and see some of these great phrases.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建器，看看一些这些很棒的短语。

segments.en: All right, three phrases we have for you here.
This is really important in airplanes, right?
segments.cn: 这在飞机上真的很重要，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, because otherwise if there's turbulence, you could end up flying around the airplane.
segments.cn: 是的，因为如果有颠簸，你可能会在飞机上飞来飞去。

segments.en: Or fall, exactly, and hurt yourself.
Now one of the reasons they had to remain seated was because they were going to go through a patch of rough air.
segments.cn: 他们必须保持坐着的原因之一是因为他们将要经过一段颠簸的空气。

segments.en: So patch is a small area, right?
segments.cn: 所以 patch 是一个小区域，对吧？

segments.en: So a small area of turbulence.
segments.cn: 所以一小块颠簸的区域。

segments.en: Now what would be another example of patch?
segments.cn: 现在 patch 的另一个例子是什么？

segments.en: So it's like a little strawberry garden, right?
segments.cn: 所以就像一个小草莓园，对吧？

segments.en: Usually in front of your house, you'll have a little patch of grass.
segments.cn: 通常在你家前面，你会有一小片草。
现在是我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: Yeah, so stop for a short time.
So you could suspend your work.
segments.cn: 所以你可以暂停你的工作。

segments.en: Yeah, and if you're going on vacation, you could suspend your subscription to the newspaper.
segments.cn: 是的，如果你去度假，你可以暂停你的报纸订阅。

segments.en: Okay, so suspend to temporarily stop.
segments.cn: 好的，所以暂停是暂时停止。

segments.en: Okay, so we've covered a lot of vocabulary and some great phrases.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们已经涵盖了很多词汇和一些很棒的短语。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to our dialogue one more time and we'll come back and talk about flying.
segments.cn: 所以我们再听一遍对话，然后再回来谈谈飞行。

segments.en: And the next thing you know, we're running towards the.
segments.cn: 然后你知道的，我们正朝着...

segments.en: We're just going through a bit of turbulence.
segments.cn: 我们只是经过一段颠簸。

segments.en: Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain speaking.
segments.cn: 各位女士们，先生们，这是你们的机长在讲话。

segments.en: It looks like we've hit a patch of rough air.
segments.cn: 看起来我们遇到了一段颠簸的空气。

segments.en: So we're going to have a bit of a bumpy ride for the next several minutes.
segments.cn: 所以接下来的几分钟我们会有一段颠簸的旅程。

segments.en: This is why I hate flying.
segments.cn: 这就是我讨厌飞行的原因。

segments.en: At this time, I'd like to remind all our passengers to fasten their seat belts and remain seated until the fasten seat belt sign is turned off.
segments.cn: 此时，我想提醒所有乘客系好安全带，并保持坐着，直到安全带指示灯熄灭。

segments.en: Please ensure that all cabin baggage is carefully stowed under the seat in front of you.
segments.cn: 请确保所有舱内行李都妥善放置在你前面的座位下。

segments.en: I'll be back to update you in a minute.
segments.cn: 我会在一分钟内回来更新你们。

segments.en: Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain again.
segments.cn: 各位女士们，先生们，这是你们的机长再次讲话。

segments.en: We've got quite a large patch of rough air ahead of us.
segments.cn: 我们前方有一段很大的颠簸空气。

segments.en: And so for your safety, we will be suspending in-flight service.
segments.cn: 所以为了你的安全，我们将暂停机上服务。

segments.en: I would ask all the in-flight crew to return to their seats at this time.
segments.cn: 我会要求所有机组人员此时返回他们的座位。

segments.en: I would also ask that all our passengers refrain from using the lavatory until the seat belt sign has been switched off.
segments.cn: 我还会要求所有乘客在安全带指示灯熄灭之前克制使用洗手间。

segments.en: Erika, have you ever had a turbulent flight like this?
segments.cn: 艾丽卡，你有没有经历过像这样的颠簸航班？
没有，没有，从来没有这么糟糕。

segments.en: Actually, I kind of like turbulent flights.
segments.cn: 实际上，我有点喜欢颠簸的航班。

segments.en: It's sort of like, I don't know, it's kind of fun.
segments.cn: 有点像，我不知道，这有点有趣。

segments.en: You get shaken around and your stomach moves up and down.
segments.cn: 你会被摇晃，肚子上下移动。

segments.en: No, I get a little excited.
Well, it is true that flying is actually very, very safe, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，确实，飞行实际上是非常安全的，对吧？

segments.en: I know we all hear that more people are killed in car accidents than flight accidents.
segments.cn: 我知道我们都听说过，汽车事故造成的死亡人数比飞行事故多。

segments.en: So yeah, I don't worry about the turbulence.
segments.cn: 所以是的，我不担心颠簸。

segments.en: Yeah, so flying is really safe.
And as long as you remain seated, you fasten your seat belt and you follow the instructions, you shouldn't have any problems.
segments.cn: 只要你保持坐着，系好安全带并遵循指示，就不会有任何问题。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah, actually, that's a really good point because actually, when I was reading about flight turbulence for this dialogue, I kept reading all these stories about these people who, you know, when they got into some turbulent air were, you know, knocked over or they ended up like actually literally flying through the cabin and getting really badly hurt.
segments.cn: 是的，实际上，这是个很好的观点，因为当我为这个对话阅读飞行颠簸时，我看到很多关于那些在颠簸空气中被撞倒或真的飞过机舱并受了重伤的人的故事。

segments.en: Everyone, you got to fasten your seat belt.
We don't want you to get hurt.
And we know that you travel a lot, so be safe, right?
segments.cn: 我们知道你经常旅行，所以要安全，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and use this language to describe your flight.
segments.cn: 是的，用这种语言来描述你的飞行。

segments.en: Okay, so come to our website EnglishPod.com where you can leave questions, you can also leave your comments.
segments.cn: 好吧，来我们的网站EnglishPod.com，你可以留下问题，也可以留下评论。

segments.en: Yeah, Marco and I are always there.
And actually, in fact, we have to go check the site now.
segments.cn: 事实上，我们现在得去检查网站。

segments.en: So yeah, we're out of time.
segments.cn: 所以是的，我们没时间了。

segments.en: So we'll see you guys next time.
